definitions: attract or charm someone as if by magnetic force
give magnetic properties to metal by aligning its atoms
examples: Her personality magnetizes everyone she meets
The speaker magnetized the audience with charisma
You can magnetize a needle by stroking it with magnet
The machine magnetizes steel components for assembly

definitions: plan and direct route or course especially of ship or aircraft
move through website or computer program using controls
examples: Ships navigate using stars and compass readings
We navigated through narrow mountain roads carefully
She navigates the website to find information
Children easily navigate modern technology interfaces

definitions: destroy utterly leaving no trace wiping out existence completely
examples: The explosion obliterated the old building entirely
Time obliterates painful memories gradually

definitions: bring peace to place or person quelling anger or agitation
examples: Music helps pacify crying babies quickly
The government tried to pacify angry protesters

definitions: express or measure quantity of something in numerical terms
examples: Scientists quantify pollution levels in parts per million
It's difficult to quantify happiness or love

definitions: attempt to explain or justify behavior with logical reasons even if inappropriate
reorganize process or system to make more logical and efficient
examples: He rationalized his lateness by blaming traffic
People often rationalize bad decisions afterward
The company rationalized production to cut costs
We need to rationalize our inventory system

definitions: deliberately destroy damage or obstruct something especially for political advantage
examples: Workers sabotaged the machinery to protest conditions
Someone sabotaged our presentation by deleting files

definitions: arrange data or information in table form systematically in columns
examples: Please tabulate the survey results by age group
Accountants tabulate expenses in spreadsheet format

definitions: make or become united uniform or whole joining separate parts
examples: The treaty unified the warring nations peacefully
Music has power to unify diverse communities

definitions: check or prove validity or accuracy of something confirming truth
make legally valid or official through formal process
examples: Research validates the new treatment method
Please validate your parking ticket before leaving
The court validated the election results officially
You must validate your passport for travel

definitions: begin to move more quickly increasing velocity or rate
cause something to happen sooner or develop faster
examples: The car accelerates from zero to sixty quickly
Runners accelerate in the final stretch
Technology accelerates social change dramatically
We need to accelerate the project timeline

definitions: attack continuously with bombs shells or other missiles overwhelming target
examples: Enemy forces bombarded the city all night
Advertisers bombard us with messages daily

definitions: mark scale with standard measurements or adjust instrument precisely
examples: Technicians calibrate the equipment before each use
You should calibrate your monitor for accurate colors

definitions: kill destroy or remove large percentage or part of something
examples: Disease decimated the population in medieval times
The storm decimated coastal communities

definitions: make something more attractive by adding decorative details or features
add fictitious details to story making it more interesting
examples: Artists embellish manuscripts with gold leaf designs
She embellished the dress with beautiful embroidery
He tends to embellish stories about his adventures
Don't embellish the truth when testifying

definitions: strengthen place with defensive works protecting against attack
add vitamins or nutrients to food increasing nutritional value
examples: Ancient cities fortified walls against invaders
We must fortify our position before battle
Manufacturers fortify breakfast cereals with vitamins
Milk is fortified with vitamin D

definitions: give someone pleasure or satisfaction fulfilling wishes or desires
examples: Your progress gratifies me immensely
It gratified her to see students succeed

definitions: bring into consonance or accord making consistent and compatible
add notes to melody to produce harmony in music
examples: We need to harmonize our schedules for the meeting
Countries must harmonize trade regulations
The choir harmonizes beautifully in four parts
Can you harmonize with this melody

definitions: admire love or revere someone excessively making them an idol
examples: Teenagers often idolize pop stars and athletes
She idolized her older sister growing up

definitions: show or prove to be right or reasonable defending actions
examples: Can you justify spending so much money
The results justify our research methods

definitions: light or set on fire starting flames or burning
arouse or inspire emotion or feeling in someone
examples: Use dry wood to kindle the campfire easily
A spark can kindle a forest fire
Her speech kindled hope in everyone's hearts
The book kindled his interest in history

definitions: set someone free from imprisonment slavery or oppression giving freedom
examples: Allied forces liberated the prisoners of war
Education liberates minds from ignorance

definitions: prepare and organize troops or resources for active service
make something movable or capable of movement
examples: The country mobilized its army for defense
Communities mobilize volunteers during disasters
Physical therapy helps mobilize stiff joints
Stretching mobilizes tight muscles

definitions: nullify or make ineffective canceling out effect of something
deny the existence truth or validity of something
examples: One mistake negates all your hard work
Rain negated our outdoor plans
You cannot negate scientific facts
The evidence negates his claims

definitions: make best or most effective use of situation or resource
examples: Engineers optimize systems for maximum efficiency
Athletes optimize training for peak performance

definitions: divide into two sharply contrasting groups or sets of opinions
examples: The issue polarized public opinion completely
Social media tends to polarize political views

definitions: be entitled to benefit or privilege by fulfilling necessary conditions
make statement less absolute adding reservations or conditions
examples: She qualified for the Olympics last year
Not everyone qualifies for this tax deduction
I should qualify my statement about the results
He qualified his praise with some criticism

definitions: calibrate something again adjusting to maintain accuracy or adapt
examples: We need to recalibrate expectations after the setback
The machine recalibrates automatically every month

definitions: cause something to become thoroughly soaked with liquid
fill something completely so no more can be absorbed
examples: Rain saturated the soil after the drought
The sponge is saturated with water
Advertisements saturate television during prime time
The market is saturated with similar products

definitions: bring to an end concluding or stopping something finally
examples: The company terminated his employment contract
Please terminate the program before shutting down

definitions: estimate something to be smaller or less important than it is
examples: Don't underestimate the time needed for this project
People often underestimate their own abilities

definitions: cause air to enter and circulate freely in room or building
give expression to feelings or opinions discussing openly
examples: Open windows to ventilate the stuffy room
Fans help ventilate enclosed spaces effectively
The meeting ventilated employee grievances openly
We need to ventilate these issues publicly

definitions: carve wood into object by repeatedly cutting small slices
reduce something gradually by removing small amounts repeatedly
examples: Grandfather whittles wooden toys for the children
He whittled a walking stick from oak branch
We need to whittle down expenses this month
Years of erosion whittled the cliff face

definitions: copy document using xerographic process making photocopy of original
examples: Please xerox these forms for the meeting
I need to xerox my passport for the application

definitions: produce or provide natural agricultural or industrial product
give way to arguments demands or pressure surrendering
examples: The farm yields excellent crops every year
Investments yield steady returns over time
Eventually he yielded to their persistent requests
Drivers must yield to pedestrians at crosswalks

definitions: move in pattern of sharp turns alternating right and left
examples: The path zigzags up the steep mountain
Lightning zigzagged across the dark sky

definitions: cause someone to feel isolated or estranged from others
examples: His behavior alienated all his former friends
Don't alienate customers with poor service

definitions: support or strengthen something making it more effective or substantial
examples: New evidence bolsters the prosecution's case
Exercise bolsters your immune system naturally

definitions: combine number of things into single more effective whole
make position of power or success stronger or more secure
examples: We consolidated three departments into one unit
Banks consolidate loans to simplify payments
The company consolidated its market leadership position
Winners must consolidate their gains carefully

definitions: cause someone to lose confidence or hope dispiriting them completely
examples: Constant criticism demoralizes even dedicated employees
The defeat demoralized the entire team

definitions: give special importance or prominence to something when speaking or writing
examples: Teachers emphasize the importance of daily reading
The report emphasizes environmental concerns strongly

definitions: rise and fall irregularly in number or amount varying unpredictably
examples: Stock prices fluctuate throughout the trading day
His mood fluctuates between joy and sadness

definitions: make general or broad statement from specific cases inferring widely
examples: You can't generalize from one example alone
Scientists generalize findings from controlled experiments

definitions: admit someone to hospital for medical treatment requiring overnight stay
examples: Doctors hospitalized him after the serious accident
The illness hospitalized several family members

definitions: create and perform spontaneously without preparation using available materials
examples: Jazz musicians improvise solos during performances
We had to improvise dinner from leftovers

definitions: write something quickly and briefly making short notes
examples: Let me jot down your phone number
Students jot notes during the lecture

definitions: work dough or clay with hands folding and pressing repeatedly
massage muscles with pressing movements to relieve tension
examples: Knead the bread dough for ten minutes
Bakers knead dough until smooth and elastic
The therapist kneads tight shoulder muscles
Cats knead blankets with their paws

definitions: close business and sell assets to pay debts ending operations
kill someone typically in planned way eliminating them
examples: The company liquidated after bankruptcy proceedings
Stores liquidate inventory during closing sales
The regime liquidated political opponents systematically
Spy novels often involve liquidating enemies

definitions: adapt something to modern needs or habits updating to current standards
examples: The factory modernized its production equipment
Many countries modernize their infrastructure gradually

definitions: bring or return to normal state or condition making standard
examples: Relations between the countries gradually normalized
The medication helps normalize blood pressure levels
